intro: Dillwynia floribunda var. teretifolia, commonly known as the narrow-leafed dillwynia, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the Fabaceae family, characterized by its pea-like flowers and compound leaves. The plant typically grows in heathlands and open forests, preferring well-drained soils. Its foliage consists of narrow, linear leaves, and it produces small, usually white or pale yellow flowers in clusters. It is valued for its ornamental appeal and ecological benefits, supporting native pollinators.
